instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3023: What is 820-3023? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT is the voltage rail for the backlight of the LCD screen. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan o.k, chime o.k usb o.k...white screen
threads.message:
hi, i have old board that i want to renew, i have full working body for it...there was very small liqde damage near lcd connector i was renew pins(2,3 <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL>) still the same, i was sew also near <CHIP>U3890</CHIP>..clean and look o.k...any idea?
THANKS!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan o.k, chime o.k usb o.k...white screen
threads.message:
Pure white screen means TFT matrix is not powered up.
Usually 3.3V doesn't arrive there.
Check another LCD assembly...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan o.k, chime o.k usb o.k...white screen
threads.message: Lcd os fine..check it with different good board

threads.message:
Then must be CPU internal problem.

Just in case, try few PRAM resets...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan o.k, chime o.k usb o.k...white screen
threads.message: PRAM not help...so reheat CPU can help? or dead board?
